title: Textile, 13th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metallic yarns (beaten gold on vellum, wrapped around silk core) 
Technique: plain compound weave
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 34.4 x 20.6 cm (13 9/16 x 8 1/8 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: A fragment from a set of vestments found at the Cathedral of Lerida. A central band of eight-pointed stars enclosing rampant lions, separated by cross-shaped ornaments. Above, a band of pseudo-Kufic letters in white on gold ground. A narrow checked band below.  In blue, pink, and yellow silk and gold metallic threads.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 13th century.
13th century. Medium: silk, metallic yarns (beaten gold on vellum, wrapped around silk core) 
Technique: plain compound weave. Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1944-21-1.
